result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aiden J. Coppersmith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called:  8:33 am  
Clerk: Kim H.
15CM515 and 15CM516
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.
Date and time set for plea hearing.  Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to DRI 15CM515 entire file.  COURT grants.  
PLEA: Count 1 - Battery>> No contest
Count 2 - Disorderly Conduct>> No contest
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: DEOJ for 18 mos.- follow conditions of agreement.  Upon successful completion of agreement, State will move to dismiss.
Court states there's to be no abusive contact with parents.
Review Date:  10/20/16 at 1:10 pm
Adj:  8:40 am

ADDRESS INFO for Aiden J. Coppersmith
Current: 1902 Buckhorn Ave, Rothschild, WI 54474 United States  (Effective: 03-27-2015)
Prior: 1240 Mcintosh Street, Wausau, WI 54403

Final pre-trial on April 29, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Jury Trial on May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 26, 2015 at 09:10 am.

INCLUDES 15CM515 & 15CM516   No contact with victim(s): T.C. & M.S.- no abusive contact. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
